project/includes/litm.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002  * @file   litm.h
00003  *
00004  * @version $version
00005  *
00006  * @date   2009-04-24
00007  * @author Jean-Lou Dupont
00008  *
00009  * @mainpage Welcome to the documentation for the library LITM -- $version
00010  *
00011  *           The library serves as a <b>Lightweight Inter-Thread Messaging</b> under Linux/Unix.
00012  *
00013  * \section Dependencies
00014  *
00015  *                      <b>Mandatory</b>
00016  *
00017  *          - libpthread
00018  *
00019  *          <b>Optional</b>
00020  *          The following components are only required if building from source:
00021  *
00022  *          - scons
00023  *
00024  *          - python package "pyjld.os" (available through <i>easy_install</i>)
00025  *
00026  *
00027  * \section     Example_Usage Example Usage:
00028  *
00029  *                      \subsection Example_Opening Opening a connection
00030  *
00031  *                      \code
00032  *
00033  *                              litm_connection *conn;
00034  *                              litm_code code = litm_connection_open( &conn );
00035  *                              switch(code) {
00036  *                               case LITM_CODE_OK:
00037  *                                              // can start using the connection
00038  *                                              break;
00039  *                               case LITM_CODE_BUSY:
00040  *                                              // better try again later
00041  *                                              break;
00042  *                               default:
00043  *                                              //something is wrong...
00044  *                                              break;
00045  *                              }
00046  *                              // if everything is OK, create our worker thread
00047  *                              params->conn = conn; // pass along the LITM connection identifier
00048  *                              pthread_t thread;
00049  *                              pthread_create( &thread, NULL, &thread_fnction, (void *) &params );
00050  *
00051  *                      \endcode
00052  *
00053  *
00054  *                      \subsection Example_Subscribing Subscribing to a _bus_
00055  *
00056  *                              \code
00057  *                              // subscribing to bus #1
00058  *                              litm_code code = litm_subscribe(conn, 1);
00059  *                                ... check return code ...
00060  *
00061  *                              \endcode
00062  *
00063  *
00064  *                      \subsection Example_Sending Sending a message on a _bus_
00065  *
00066  *                              \code
00067  *                              // litm connection should be passed through the thread params
00068  *                              void *thread_function(void *params) {
00069  *
00070  *                                      void *message; // whatever structure
00071  *                                      litm_code code = litm_send(conn, bus_id, message, NULL);
00072  *                                       ... check return code ...
00073  *
00074  *                                      ...
00075  *
00076  *                              }//thread_function
00077  *                              \endcode
00078  *
00079  *
00080  *                      \subsection Example_Sending_Shutdown Sending a message on a _bus_ and initiating shutdown
00081  *
00082  *                                              The following will send a message around the _bus_ and once
00083  *                                              all active subscribers have released the message, _litm_ will
00084  *                                              terminate its _switch_ thread.
00085  *
00086  *
00087  *                              \code
00088  *                              // litm connection should be passed through the thread params
00089  *                              void *thread_function(void *params) {
00090  *
00091  *                                      void *message; // whatever structure
00092  *                                      litm_code code = litm_send_shutdown(conn, bus_id, message, NULL);
00093  *                                       ... check return code ...
00094  *
00095  *                                      ...
00096  *
00097  *                              }//thread_function
00098  *                              \endcode
00099  *
00100  *                      \subsection Example_Receiving Receiving a message
00101  *
00102  *                              \code
00103  *                                      ... inside the thread_function ...
00104  *
00105  *                                      litm_envelope *envelope;
00106  *                                      litm_code code = litm_receive_nb(conn, &envelope);
00107  *                                       ... check return code ...
00108  *
00109  *                                      void *msg;
00110  *                                      msg = litm_get_message( envelope );
00111  *
00112  *                                       ... process message WITHOUT MODIFYING IT ...
00113  *
00114  *                                      // return the envelope to LITM
00115  *                                      code = litm_release(conn, envelope);
00116  *
00117  *                              \endcode
00118  *
00119  *
00120  * \section Connecting_Subscribing Connecting and Subscribing
00121  *
00122  *              \msc
00123  *                      Client, LITM;
00124  *
00125  *                      Client => LITM [label="litm_connect()"];
00126  *                      Client => LITM [label="litm_subscribe()"];
00127  *
00128  *              \endmsc
00129  *
00130  *
00131  * \section Sending_Receiving  Sending and Receiving process
00132  *
00133  *
00134  *              \msc
00135  *                      Sender, LITM, Receivers;
00136  *
00137  *                      Sender    => LITM      [label="litm_send()"];
00138  *                      LITM      -> Receivers [label="litm_receive()"];
00139  *                      Receivers => LITM      [label="litm_release()"];
00140  *                      ...;
00141  *                      LITM      -> Receivers [label="litm_receive()"];
00142  *                      Receivers => LITM      [label="litm_release()"];
00143  *
00144  *              \endmsc
00145  *
00146  * \section Shutdown  Shutdown process
00147  *
00148  *
00149  *              \msc
00150  *                      Sender, LITM, Receivers;
00151  *
00152  *                      Sender    => LITM      [label="litm_send_shutdown()"];
00153  *                      LITM      -> Receivers [label="litm_receive_wait()"];
00154  *                      Receivers => LITM      [label="litm_release()"];
00155  *                      ...;
00156  *                      LITM      -> Receivers [label="litm_receive_wait()"];
00157  *                      Receivers => LITM      [label="litm_release()"];
00158  *                      ---                                             [label="'main' thread must call litm_wait_shutdown()"];
00159  *                      Sender    => LITM               [label="litm_wait_shutdown()"];
00160  *
00161  *              \endmsc
00162 
00163  *
00164  *
00165  *
00166  * \section Release_Notes Release Notes
00167  *
00168  *              \subsection release_0_1 Release 0.1
00169  *
00170  *                                                              \li Initial release
00171  *
00172  *              \subsection release_0_2 Release 0.2
00173  *
00174  *                                                              \li Added litm_receive_wait function
00175  *
00176  *              \subsection release_0_3 Release 0.3
00177  *
00178  *                                                              \li Added 50ms sleeping in switch thread
00179  *                                                              \li Added _queue_put_head_ support for high priority messaging
00180  *                                                              \li Added _litm_send_shutdown_ function: coordinated shutdown
00181  *
00182  *              \subsection release_0_4 Release 0.4
00183  *
00184  *                                                              \li Notable speed increase (added forced interleaving of client threads through usleep)
00185  *                                                              \li Added support for quicker shutdown procedure (put shutdown message at ``head`` of queue(s))
00186  *                                                              \li Removed litm_shutdown function
00187  *                                                              \li Added coordination for all queue activity through pthread condition variable: no useless blocking
00188  *
00189  * \todo Better connection close
00190  *
00191  */
00192 
00193 #ifndef LITM_H_
00194 #define LITM_H_

00196 #       include <sys/types.h>
00197 #       include <pthread.h>

00200 #       define LITM_CONNECTION_MAX      15
00201 #       define LITM_BUSSES_MAX          7
00202 #       define LITM_DEFAULT_MAX_TIMEOUT 5
00203 #       define LITM_DEFAULT_MAX_BACKOFF 1

00205                 /**
00206                  * Queue node - entry in a queue
00207                  *
00208                  * @param msg:  pointer to the message
00209                  * @param next: pointer to the ``next`` queue_node entry
00210                  */
00211                 typedef struct _queue_node {
00212                         void *node;
00213                         struct _queue_node *next;
00214                 } queue_node;
00215 
00216                 /**
00217                  * Queue - thread-safe
00218                  *
00219                  * @param mutex: mutex
00220                  * @param cond:  the condition variable
00221                  * @param head:  pointer to ``head``
00222                  * @param tail:  pointer to ``tail``
00223                  */
00224                 typedef struct {
00225                         pthread_cond_t  *cond;
00226                         pthread_mutex_t *cond_mutex;
00227                         pthread_mutex_t *mutex;
00228                         struct _queue_node *head, *tail;
00229                         int num;
00230                         int id;
00231                         int total_in;
00232                         int total_out;
00233                 } queue;
00234 
00235 
00236                 /**
00237                  * ``Bus`` identifier type
00238                  */
00239                 typedef int litm_bus;
00240 
00241                 /**
00242                  * ``Connection Status`` type
00243                  */
00244                 typedef enum _litm_connection_status_codes {
00245                         LITM_CONNECTION_STATUS_INVALID = 0,
00246                         LITM_CONNECTION_STATUS_ACTIVE,
00247                         LITM_CONNECTION_STATUS_PENDING_DELETION
00248                 } litm_connection_status;
00249 
00250                 /**
00251                  * ``Connection`` type
00252                  *
00253                  * @param input_queue the connection's input queue
00254                  */
00255                 typedef struct _litm_connection {
00256                         int received;
00257                         int released;
00258                         int sent;
00259                         int id;
00260                         litm_connection_status status;
00261                         queue *input_queue;
00262                 } litm_connection;
00263 
00264                 //typedef _litm_connection litm_connection;

00266                 /**
00267                  * Envelope Routing
00268                  *
00269                  * @param pending Pending Status Flag
00270                  * @param bus_id  Destination ``bus``
00271                  * @param sender  The sender's connection pointer
00272                  * @param current The index of the current recipient in the subscriber's list
00273                  */
00274                 typedef struct {
00275                         int                              pending;
00276                         litm_bus         bus_id;
00277                         litm_connection *sender;
00278                         int                     current;
00279                         litm_connection *current_conn;
00280                 } __litm_routing;
00281 
00282 
00283 
00284 
00285                 // Return Codes
00286                 // ------------
00287                 //
00288                 typedef enum _litm_codes {
00289                         LITM_CODE_OK = 0,
00290                         LITM_CODE_NO_MESSAGE,
00291                         LITM_CODE_BUSY,
00292                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_MALLOC,
00293                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_OPEN,
00294                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION,
00295                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_NO_MORE_CONNECTIONS,
00296                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS,
00297                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_SENDER_EQUAL_CURRENT,
00298                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NO_CURRENT,
00299                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NEXT_NOT_FOUND,
00300                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_OUTPUT_QUEUING,                                 //can't send to the recipient
00301                         LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE,
00302                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE,
00303                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND,
00304                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_BUS_FULL,
00305                         LITM_CODE_BUSY_CONNECTIONS,
00306                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_NOT_ACTIVE,
00307                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_END_OF_SUBSCRIBERS_LIST,
00308                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_NO_SUBSCRIBERS,
00309                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_ERROR,
00310                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SUBSCRIPTION_ERROR,
00311                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SEND_ERROR,
00312                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_RECEIVE_WAIT
00313 
00314                 } litm_code;
00315 
00316 
00317                 /**
00318                  * ``Envelope`` structure for messages
00319                  *
00320                  * @param cleaner The ``cleaner`` function to use
00321                  * @param routes  The ``routing`` structure
00322                  * @param msg     The pointer to the message
00323                  *
00324                  * Contains the pointer to the message
00325                  *  as well as a ``routing`` structure
00326                  *  used to deliver the said message
00327                  *  to all bus which have at least
00328                  *  1 subscriber.
00329                  *
00330                  * The client (ie. receiver of the envelope)
00331                  *  must not tamper with the message (ie. msg)
00332                  *  as it is shared with other client(s).
00333                  *
00334                  */
00335                 typedef struct _litm_envelope {
00336 
00337                         int requeued;
00338                         int shutdown_flag;
00339                         int released_count;
00340                         int delivery_count;
00341                         void (*cleaner)(void *msg);
00342                         __litm_routing routes;
00343                         void *msg;
00344 
00345                 } litm_envelope;
00346 
00347 
00348                 /**
00349                  * Opens a ``connection`` to the ``switch``
00350                  *  and returns a pointer to the connection reference
00351                  *
00352                  * @param **conn pointer to connection reference
00353                  */
00354                 litm_code litm_connect(litm_connection **conn);
00355 
00356                 /**
00357                  * Opens a ``connection`` to the ``switch``
00358                  *  and returns a pointer to the connection reference
00359                  *
00360                  * @see litm_connect
00361                  *
00362                  * @param **conn pointer to connection reference
00363                  * @param id connection identifier
00364                  *
00365                  */
00366                 litm_code litm_connect_ex(litm_connection **conn, int id);
00367 
00368                 /**
00369                  * Opens a ``connection`` to the ``switch``
00370                  *  and returns a pointer to the connection reference.
00371                  *  Waits for a maximum of ``timeout``.
00372                  *
00373                  * @see litm_connect
00374                  *
00375                  * @param **conn pointer to connection reference
00376                  * @param id connection identifier
00377                  * @param timeout timeout in seconds, 0 for the default
00378                  *
00379                  */
00380                 litm_code litm_connect_ex_wait(litm_connection **conn, int id, int timeout);

00384                  * Returns the connection associated with a valid connection
00385                  *
00386                  * @return -1 on error
00387                  */
00388                 int litm_connection_get_id(litm_connection *conn);

00391                 /**
00392                  * Disconnects from the ``switch``
00393                  *
00394                  * Once a client calls this function, no more access
00395                  * with the connection is permitted to any of the
00396                  * following functions:
00397                  *
00398                  *  - litm_subscribe
00399                  *  - litm_unsubscribe
00400                  *  - litm_receive_nb
00401                  *  - litm_send
00402                  *  - litm_release
00403                  *
00404                  * Be sure to release any message in the client's
00405                  * care before disconnecting.
00406                  *
00407                  * @param *conn connection reference
00408                  */
00409                 litm_code litm_disconnect(litm_connection *conn);
00410 
00411 
00412                 /**
00413                  * Subscribe to a ``bus``
00414                  *
00415                  * @see litm_disconnect
00416                  *
00417                  * @param *conn connection reference
00418                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` identifier to subscribe to
00419                  *
00420                  */
00421                 litm_code litm_subscribe(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id);
00422 
00423 
00424                 /**
00425                  * @see litm_subscribe
00426                  */
00427                 litm_code litm_subscribe_wait(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id, int timeout);
00428 
00429                 /**
00430                  * Unsubscribe from a ``bus``
00431                  *
00432                  * @see litm_disconnect
00433                  *
00434                  * @param *conn connection reference
00435                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` identifier to unsubscribe from
00436                  */
00437                 litm_code litm_unsubscribe(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id);
00438 
00439 
00440                 /**
00441                  * Send message on a ``bus``
00442                  *
00443                  * @see litm_disconnect
00444                  *
00445                  * @param *conn connection reference
00446                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` to send the message onto
00447                  * @param *msg the pointer to the message
00448                  * @param *cleaner the pointer to the cleaner function
00449                  *
00450                  * If omitted, the default ``cleaner`` function will be
00451                  * <b>free()</b>.
00452                  *
00453                  * If an error occurs, it is the responsibility of the sender
00454                  *  to dispose of the ``messages`` appropriately.  If the
00455                  *  operation went LITM_CODE_OK, then once all recipients
00456                  *  are finished with the message, the ``cleaner`` will be
00457                  *  called with the message pointer OR if ``cleaner`` is
00458                  *  NULL, the message will simply be freed with free().
00459                  *
00460                  */
00461                 litm_code litm_send(    litm_connection *conn,
00462                                                                 litm_bus bus_id,
00463                                                                 void *msg,
00464                                                                 void (*cleaner)(void *msg)
00465                                                                 );
00466 
00467                 /**
00468                  * @see litm_send_wait
00469                  */
00470                 litm_code litm_send_wait(       litm_connection *conn,
00471                                                                         litm_bus bus_id,
00472                                                                         void *msg,
00473                                                                         void (*cleaner)(void *msg),
00474                                                                         int timeout
00475                                                                 );
00476 
00477                 /**
00478                  * Send message on a _bus_ and shutdown
00479                  *
00480                  * Sends the message around to the subscribers and
00481                  *  once the message has been released by the last
00482                  *  subscriber, performs a shutdown of the switch thread.
00483                  *
00484                  * Each client subscriber is responsible for recognizing
00485                  *  the message (since litm does not interpret client
00486                  *  messages) and terminate its access to litm & terminates
00487                  *  its threads.
00488                  *
00489                  * @see litm_send
00490                  *
00491                  * @param *conn connection reference
00492                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` to send the message onto
00493                  * @param *msg the pointer to the message
00494                  * @param *cleaner the pointer to the cleaner function
00495                  */
00496                 litm_code litm_send_shutdown(   litm_connection *conn,
00497                                                                                 litm_bus bus_id,
00498                                                                                 void *msg,
00499                                                                                 void (*cleaner)(void *msg)
00500                                                                         );
00501 
00502                 void litm_wait_shutdown(void);
00503 
00504 
00505                 /**
00506                  * Receives (non-blocking) from any ``bus``
00507                  *
00508                  * @see litm_disconnect
00509                  *
00510                  * @param *conn connection reference
00511                  * @param **envlp the pointer to received envelope
00512                  *
00513                  */
00514                 litm_code litm_receive_nb(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope **envlp);
00515 
00516                 /**
00517                  * Receives (waiting) from any ``bus``
00518                  *
00519                  * @see litm_disconnect
00520                  *
00521                  * @param *conn connection reference
00522                  * @param **envlp the pointer to received envelope
00523                  *
00524                  */
00525                 litm_code litm_receive_wait(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope **envlp);
00526 
00527 
00528                 /**
00529                  * Releases an ``envelope``
00530                  *
00531                  * @see litm_disconnect
00532                  *
00533                  * @param *conn connection reference
00534                  * @param *envlp the pointer to received envelope to release
00535                  *
00536                  *  Once the client has consumed the message
00537                  *  ``contained`` in the envelope, the client
00538                  *  **MUST** release it back to litm.
00539                  */
00540                 litm_code litm_release(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope *envlp);
00541 
00542 
00543 
00544                 /**
00545                  * Returns a copy of the pointer to the message.
00546                  *
00547                  * @param *envlp the envelope from which to extract the pointer to the message
00548                  *
00549                  * This function should be used instead
00550                  *  of relying on the ``litm_envelope``
00551                  *  data structure.
00552                  *
00553                  *  <b>** DO NOT** modify the message!</b>
00554                  *
00555                  */
00556                 void *litm_get_message(litm_envelope *envlp);

00559                 /**
00560                  * Translates a code to a message pointer
00561                  *
00562                  * @param code a <i>litm_code</i> to translate to a string version
00563                  *
00564                  */
00565                 char *litm_translate_code(litm_code code);
